body_text:
The about:studies study listing visual design is in this mildly outdated mockup.
Here's the major divergences from that mockup:

We will be standalone instead of integrated in about:addons. We will still have a sidebar (which will eventually list multiple types of studies).
There will be no search box or settings gear in the top right.
There will be no "X days remaining" indicator in the listings
There will be no Preferences buttons for studies.
There will be no "More" link besides study descriptions.

Here's the spec for listing behavior:

The list should contain entries for all active and former studies.

Study name
Study description.
Active / Inactive status


Clicking remove should uninstall the study, and have the same UX as the remove button on the extensions tab.

There should be no option to Undo uninstalling the study.


The add-on details page should only have a button for leaving the study.
The “Learn More” link at the top should link to a SUMO page describing studies.
The “Settings” button at the top should open the Advanced -> Data Choices preferences page.

@MattGrimes Do we have final copy for this page?

title: Add study listing to about:studies
body:
The `about:studies` study listing visual design is in [this mildly outdated mockup](https://mozilla.invisionapp.com/share/UC9XM7O9X#/screens/212795383_Experiments_Tab).

Here's the major divergences from that mockup:

- We will be standalone instead of integrated in `about:addons`. We will still have a sidebar (which will eventually list multiple types of studies).
- There will be no search box or settings gear in the top right.
- There will be no "X days remaining" indicator in the listings
- There will be no Preferences buttons for studies.
- There will be no "More" link besides study descriptions.

Here's the spec for listing behavior:

- The list should contain entries for all active and former studies.
  - Study name
  - Study description.
  - Active / Inactive status
- Clicking remove should uninstall the study, and have the same UX as the remove button on the extensions tab.
  - There should be no option to Undo uninstalling the study.
- The add-on details page should only have a button for leaving the study.
- The “Learn More” link at the top should link to a SUMO page describing studies.
- The “Settings” button at the top should open the Advanced -> Data Choices preferences page.

@MattGrimes Do we have final copy for this page?
